title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: The first round is a recorded interview, and the final round is a tech+behavioral interview. Will ask you about how do you handle the workload and the relationship with students.
Interview Questions: Asked What is the p-value?

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: The building manager position is within campus recreation. You originally start as a facility attendant (entry level role under work-study) and after working there for a year you can apply for promotion. There is typically one interview with the facilities coordinator and the program specialists (highest student employee positions) and then promotion decisions are made.
Interview Questions: What would you describe as your management style?

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very engaging and in person. The woman was lovely and asked me about 4 or 5 questions about my experiences and general questions such as top ten list and favorite books.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite book and why?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process only just to determine your schedule for the semester, which was extremely easy on my part. they were extremely friendly as well and I looked forward to working there.
Interview Questions: What is your schedule like

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: I applied via their web portal and they had admissions counselors who were incredibly helpful in completing all of the work, which included references, a personal statement, transcripts, and 1-2 other unique to my program things to submit. The toughest part was getting the transcripts, so make sure to give that plenty of time.
Interview Questions: Provide references to attest to my ability to create graduate work.

title: Assistant Teaching Professor (9 Month) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Cornwall on Hudson, NY)
Interview Descriptions: They will ask you for 3 letters of reference and teaching evaluations before you even interview. The first interview is short and sweet and that determines if you’re invited to campus.
Interview Questions: What are classes that you would enjoy teaching?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were conducted over phone due to safety measures during COVID. Scheduling was done over email and interviews were set up within a few days. Everyone was very kind and accommodating.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of three rounds. The questions were mainly behavioral-based interviews.  Expected questions that were related to the job function and expectation.  Also being able to articulate the connection of past experience and future needs in the role.
Interview Questions: - Share about yourself and what interests you about the role?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: It was mostly behavioral based. They focus on questions that help them understand how you experienced undergrad at WFU..and what you will share with prospective students. 2 interviews, the final one is with the Dean.
Interview Questions: What are you taking away from undergrad experience?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Surprisingly enjoyable interview process, despite the usual length and intensity that's expected from higher education. Three different sessions that culminated with a full-day interview. It seemed as though the search committee and hiring manager really cared about the comfort of the candidates.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wake Forest University in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy, online. The interviewers were excellent and amicable. The questions asked were as expected. The interviewer panel is patient and mature. They do not offer a good salary, though. The position expects more work than what they pay.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy

title: Teacher - Scholar Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Had just one interview- on zoom. The interviewer told me the interview is supposed to be informal and made me feel like my application was strong and they really wanted me.
Interview Questions: Among other questions, one question was, why Wake Forest University?

title: Summer Immersion Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Very cordial interview, nothing to trip you up and more of a personality interview/opportunity to ask questions and discuss previous experience. Learned a lot about the program plans in interview too.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself (academically and free-time).

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. applied online, 30 mins 1st round interview. Call on time and 3 or 4 interviewers over the phone, basic introduction and then asked behavior questions one by one.
Interview Questions: Tell me your strength and weakness

title: Community Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial one-way interview with 10 questions and only one take; second round interview with the search committee; third round on-campus interview that took six hours and visited with various individuals in the department and across the college.
Interview Questions: Please describe your style of managing students.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Good, friendly, values thinking outside of the bubble. Be personable and be ready to answer very tailored questions in regards to the institution and your fit into the teaching-scholar model.
Interview Questions: How would you balance teaching and research

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: There were two Interviews, one of them was the  Group Interview and the other was an Individual Interview with multiple interviewers including an experienced RA, community director, general hall director... really anyone in the resident life and housing department that’s available to interview future candidates.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you and to deal with conflict in the workplace?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was very quick and smooth, it was mostly behavioral questions. The interviewer was super nice and patient. The interview lasted about 30 minutes and it was overall a great experience.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your communication skills?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: An email invitation to Webex interview around February. No words after the interview. Committee comprised of 3 assistant professors. The style was very formal. It lasted about 20 minutes and at the end they mentioned they might get back tome in 1 month which I never heard back.
Interview Questions: The challenges of creating a new department?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward if you prepare ahead of time. Other than that great! Very friendly faculty who are easy to connect with. They all want you to succeed and will pull for you every way they can as long as you meet them half way.
Interview Questions: Strengths, weaknesses, why you want to work there

title: GA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then took 30 mins phone interview with 3 people after several weeks. They took turns to ask questions in one room. I think they had your resume when interviewing.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weakness.

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: After two phone interviews, I was invited for a day long in-person interview and had five interviews back to back and even lunch which was not provided was during one of the interviews. Very exhausting and not satisfying. They didn't pay for ground transportation and meals. I wouldn't take the job even if it was offered. The worst is that they didn't even contact me to say I was not selected after an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: What are some challenges that you have faced on your job and how did you solve them?

title: Career Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: I had I applied, then had a phone interview, one-on-one in-person, and group interview. The interview process was well-planned and organized. Everyone was very nice. From there I received an offer, and the working experience was worth the process.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in the role?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Lots of behavioral interview questions. Need to deliver presentations and come in with some strategic plans or directions depending on the role.  Be prepared to discuss previous success and measurable impact of your work. Showcase your creativity and ability to work collaboratively with others. They like rock stars in their field.
Interview Questions: What challenges and opportunities do you see for the university in this particular area?

title: Sports Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and informal interview process. Was interviewed by two very nice employees who seemed to care about students. They thoroughly explained the job requirements and tasks required of me in detail.
Interview Questions: How will this internship help you achieve your goals?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Teaching demonstration and research talk, interviews with faculty in the academic department, the Provost and Dean.  The whole process took almost two days and is pretty grueling, but just be yourself, and people are nice, and there because they already think you're a good fit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Wake Forest?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Not really an interview, but behavioral based. asked me about my experiences and at the time I was a student, so my experiences on campus. The process wasn't long, fairly straight forward and easy.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous work experience?

title: Global Programs Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: A one-way video interview with unlimited time to think and had three chances to record the video. I enjoyed this experience as I wasn't caught off guard and had time to compose my answer.
Interview Questions: What unique qualities would I bring to the job?

title: Gym Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews lasting about half an hour each. I asked questions about personality, work ethic, and time commitment. Offered a job via email one week after the final interview. Interviewers we flexible with scheduling
Interview Questions: Describe your leadership style

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview (30 minutes) with Director and Assistant Director. Asked questions about background experience and hypotheticals. Was called within that week to schedule an in-person interview. In-Person interview was a full-day interview (all travel expenses paid). Met with several department team members throughout the day with a mix of individual and group sessions. It was exhausting, but the variety of interactions kept the day flowing.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this position? What is your background? Why Wake Forest?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone, In Person. 12 people in one day. Very exhaustive. Lots of different people, no one seemed very prepared. There were good questions, you could just tell it had not been coordinated between the various interviewers. Did not leave much time to learn about the organizations or ask questions.Where do you see yourself in 5 years. What experience do you have in higher ed. Why did you choose to apply. What is a weakness that you have? How would others describe you?
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years. What experience do you have in higher ed. Why did you choose to apply. What is a weakness that you have? How would others describe you?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: My first round of interviews was with one person. For my second round, I had multiple interviews back to back, including some group interviews. I met with HR and team members from all levels including the program Associate Dean. Most of the interviews were conversations, not grueling questions. The offer was made within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: What is your coaching style?

title: Marketing/Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: A few questions. Really not that intense at all. It really wasn't an interview at all because this was for work-study so I was essentially given the job. People in the office are great, culture was great
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Admission Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: A very cozy and conversational interview. Applicants were allowed to be themselves and it was more of an intellectual conversation between friends or relatives. Aside from the standard questions, the interviewer wanted to see who you were as a person rather than just a number. It didn't have a time limit and applicants could be as expressible and honest as they liked. They looked at character a lot more than just credentials.
Interview Questions: Describe an issue that you would march on Washington for.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and more of a conversation. I talked about my background and my interests. I talked about what led me to want to pursue a career in business and how my undergraduate degree can help me in my future. It was a great interview and was very laid back.
Interview Questions: Name a strength and a weakness.

title: Resident Adviser Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions:
A couple steps -- 
(1) Online application. Make your project something memorable. 
(2) Interview Day. Three stages - (i)Group interview where you and three others look over a sheet of fictitious RA applicants. You rank them from most likely to be hired to least, and then defend your rankings in a discussion with the rest of the group. (ii) Individual test where you act as an RA in a scene that you might encounter as an RA, i.e. what would you say to a homesick resident? (iii) Finally, later in the day, panel interview with Reslife employee and current RAs.
Interview Questions: Describe the different hats you wear as a Wake Forest Student!

title: MSA Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: By scheduled
Interview Questions: Would you change your career goal if you were not admitted by grad school?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions:
Applied to MCB program with 1150 GRE. 3.26 uGPA Biology. 
I received a phone call offering an option of two interview weekends and had some follow up emails.  There was a dinner friday night where you meet a lot of applicants and professors from multiple programs.  Saturday is all day interviews combined with tours of the hospital and facilities. There were four one-on-one interviews with Principal Investigators. They try to match you with professors of your choosing. Afterwards there was a tour of Winston Salem, then another dinner.
Interview Questions: What will you do if this doesn't work out?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume, cover letter and references. Contacted for a video skype interview. After moving through that process, went to Winston Salem to campus for an on campus interview. The entire process was professional, helped me grow and was very impressive.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working in admissions?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview requires meeting and speaking with several managers in and out of the office I applied to. Each meeting was a minimum of thirty minutes with the manager asking questions about my skills and background. Everyone was friendly and willing to offer information on the work environment and the work culture.
Interview Questions: Describe a weakness and how you overcame it.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Three 30min one-on-one interviews with faculty members. Interview styles are largely dependent on the interviewer. Some people are nice and try to make the interview like a conversation. It can become tricky if you run into a tough professor.
Interview Questions: Have you done research? What's your research experience? Why do you want to go to graduate school and why you choose Wake?

title: Employer Experience Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds: phone, one-on-one, then group. Each round was well organized and the interviewers were polite and on-time. The group interview involved the entire staff at the time. They asked a series of planned questions and one question that was fun and light.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: ETL/SQL Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied on-line off job board hit (SimplyHired.com).  Contacted for a phone interview.  30 minute phone interview with the actual manager role would report to.  Then invited on-site for panel interview with manager, project manager, and contract SQL Developer they had kept on staff for 1 year to begin customization of BlackBaud.  Two weeks later received an e-mail decline.
Interview Questions: Describe in detail the system tables you'll need to query against to build documentation from the ground up for an undocumented series of database tables, and which fields would be key from those tables?

title: University Advancement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact was via phone; wanted me to come (from out of state) within a few days but was able to schedule for two weeks from them. Took a few back and forths in order to nail down an exact date. Actual interview involved several one-on-one meetings as well as several group meetings plus lunch.
Interview Questions: This job involves long hours (duh...what job doesn't)

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate (Physics) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are not in depth; does not focus on passion for teaching.  Seems to be a hit and miss interview process.   Peer involvement is limited s you don't have chance to evaluate department collegiality.
Interview Questions: What research are you interested in.  I am not.  I want to teach.

title: Post Doctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly like any other interview. Phone interview, then in person interview with a group of investigators and then was given the job offer
Interview Questions: Do you think you can handle and bring this project to success?

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited by an outside search firm retained to support Wake Forest in its development department's expansion.  After a fairly thorough phone screen, I heard nothing for about 4 weeks, then received a phone call directly from the in-house recruiting team to set up an in-person interview. The whole process was beautifully managed, from putting me up at Graylen, an historic house that is now a hotel and conference center, to the actual day of interviews.  It was not until I got there that I realized I was a finalist, not an early-round candidate, and met with nearly a dozen people in one day. Everyone was gracious, easy to interact with during the interviews, and seemed well-prepared.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: General Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wake Forest University (Winston-Salem, NC) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: prescreen on the phone, visit for 1 on 1 interview, drug test within 2 days, backgrounch check, the best thing to do is be calm and give good eye contact.  it is hard to get in without knowing someone. when you get the offer the drug test must be taken in 2 days or less or they will withdraw the offer
Interview Questions: why should be select you
